results.title: Die Deutschen luftwaffe. No. 6. Bombers & bomber ops 1942-1945
results.creator_credit: Mickey Shephard, Mike Croker and VAF Productions
results.brief_description: This documentary video contains some rare archival footage of the German Luftwaffe carrying out some of their bombing operations during the years 1942-1945 of World War II including photo-intelligence surveillance, aerial bombings, strikes on allied convoys with anti-ship missiles and night bomber raids against the British. At one stage during 1942, the Luftwaffe were capable of launching up to 1000 sorties per day. However by 1944 due to the growing effectiveness of Allied air power, the Luftwaffe bombing force began to decline, until Germany’s eventual surrender in May 1945. Aeroplane enthusiasts, and particularly those into war planes, will enjoy this documentary for its informative and historical visuals and its coverage of the various bombers used by the Luftwaffe, including the Junkers Ju-88 and Ju-188, the Dornier 217 series and the Heinkel He-111 and He-177, as well as flying boats and float planes operating from the Mediterranean through to the Arctic Ocean (in rare colour footage). Narrated by Brian Matthews.

results.title: Didjeridu: with Charlie McMahon (A)
results.creator_credit: Paul Tait, Jeni Kendell and Gaia Films
results.brief_description: A journey with Charlie McMahon from the famed band “Gondwanaland” into the beautiful country of the Northern Territory. Accompanied by Aboriginal players and makers of the didjeridu, we see how the instruments are made and played by experts.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Tait, Jeni Kendell and Gaia Films

results.title: Did You Used to Be R. D. Laing?
results.creator_credit: Andrew Feldmar, Tom Shandel, Kirk Tongas and Third Mind Productions
results.brief_description: Scottish psychiatrist, R.D. Laing, who died in 1989 shortly after this film was made, gained a reputation for his radical objection to conventional psychiatry. He opened the discipline to question in his books, “The Divided Self” and “Politics of Experience”. This video is a compilation of a series of public lectures and private conversations made by Laing shortly after his sixtieth birthday. He is revealed to be a charismatic and consummate storyteller who draws on his thirty-five years of pondering the fundamental issues of living, loving, suffering and healing.

results.title: Dickie bird: a bird's eye view of cricket
results.creator_credit: Brian Klein, Norman Giller, Video Collection International and On the Box Productions
results.brief_description: It is rare in a sport such as cricket that an umpire should have as much of a reputation and following as the players over which he adjudicates. Umpire Dickie Bird is a prime example of this exception to the rule. In this video he reflects on his most enjoyable moments from the game, reflecting on some of the greatest performances and players he’s seen, and culminates in Dickie donning the cricket whites to face one of the fastest West Indian bowlers ever.
results.title_for_label: Dickie bird: a bird’s eye view of cricket

results.title: Dick Whittington and his cat
results.creator_credit: Tad Wilkosh and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description: Set in the Middle Ages using puppet animation to tell the story of the boy whose affection for a stray cat leads to wealth and fame, showing that kindness and goodness prevail. Narrated by Stanley Jackson. Written by Israel M. Berman.

results.title: Dick Tracy. Vol. 2
results.creator_credit: Alan James and Republic Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: This movie serial sees for the first time on screen Dick Tracy (Ralph Byrd) and his G-men battling against urban evil. This time it’s the club-footed mastermind know as The Lame One who plots a war on the G-men. Using his stratospheric aircraft he terrorises the city with his high-frequency sound wave weapon. At the same time, The Spider Gang kidnap Tracy’s brother, Gordon. Part two contains episodes eight to thirteen.

results.title: Dick Smith: make-up artist
results.creator_credit: David E. Smith and Texture Films
results.brief_description: Dick Smith talks about his work as a make up artist for the motion picture industry. He shows the aging techniques he used on Dustin Hoffman in ‘Little Big Man’ and Marlon Brando in ‘The Godfather’. Narrated by David Luster.

results.title: Dick Sharp and the case of the missing white-out
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
Private eye Dick Sharp gets embroiled in mystery, corruption, big business and double crossing while he endeavours to find the criminal responsible for stealing all the white-out in the city. A 1940’s noir style mystery thriller.
